context_meta.title: Preliminary 3.9 Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Near San Jose
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE (CBS SF) — A magnitude 3.9 earthquake struck in the hills east of San Jose Monday morning, according to the U.S. Geological Survey. The USGS reports that the earthquake struck at 9:40 a.m. about five miles east of Alum Rock, at a depth of five miles. More information to come.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Long-awaited BMX park opens in San Jose
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — Standing on the edge of the city's new BMX park at Lake Cunningham Action Sports Park Saturday, Nova Hairston described her excitement as she watched fellow bikers whiz through the fresh dirt jump line, with one word: “Wow.” “I can't wait to ride,” she said. “This is gorgeous. Not just how the jumps look, but also the scenery with the trees. You don't feel like you're in a city.” Hairston was one of dozens of BMX riders at the park's grand opening Saturday — a milestone for the local dignitaries and professional riders who for the past decade have advocated passionately for the new bike park. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Cabrera helps to shut out Stockton, San Jose wins 3-0
context_meta.summary: Sandro Cabrera and three other pitchers combined for a shutout as the San Jose Giants topped the Stockton Ports 3-0 on Friday. Cabrera (2-0) went 3 1/3 scoreless innings, allowing three hits while striking out five and walking one to pick up the win. Brian Howard (1-1) went 5 1/3 innings, allowing two runs and two hits in the California League game. Rodolfo Martinez retired the side in order for his second save of the season.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Letter: San Jose BART extension will be a boon to the carless
context_meta.summary: San Jose BART extension a boon to area residents I do not remember how long it has been since I last heard that BART was planning to extend the BART transit line to the San Jose area from San Francisco. If BART connects San Francisco and San Jose, it would be truly beneficial for residents living in San Jose and its environs. For instance, those who are attending San Jose State University would be able to casually visit San Francisco for a job interview after classes without having to own a car and be bothered by notorious traffic jams. It's been stated that the technological and safety issues will be resolved. San Francisco has more complex geography and traffic yet has incorporated the underground

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Opinion: Why San Jose should prioritize suicide prevention
context_meta.summary: Every year, between 54 and 75 San Jose residents die by suicide.  That is higher than the number of auto-related deaths in the city.  That is higher than the murder rate in the city. Every year, nearly 45,000 Americans take their own lives—significantly higher than the 35,000 who die by gun violence annually in America.  And when you consider the fact that 62 percent (over 21,000) of those who die by gun are suicides, the urgency and tragic pervasiveness of suicide come into sharp focus. Suicide is a big and complicated issue, but we can all play a role in reducing the number of these entirely preventable deaths—as individuals, as families, and as a community. context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Dunshee, Persico lift Stockton over San Jose 4-1
context_meta.summary: Luke Persico doubled and singled twice, and Parker Dunshee tossed five scoreless innings as the Stockton Ports defeated the San Jose Giants 4-1 on Thursday. Dunshee (1-0) allowed one hit while striking out four and walking one to pick up the win. Stockton got on the board first in the third inning when Greg Deichmann hit a two-run double and then scored on a double by Jonah Heim. After Stockton added a run in the fifth when Kevin Merrell scored on a ground out, the Giants cut into the deficit in the sixth inning when Jacob Heyward scored on an error.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Dynamo, Earthquakes look for first win since opening week
context_meta.summary: Houston Dynamo players have had some extra time to consider a perplexing loss. Houston, which is coming off a bye week, fell 2-0 to New England on March 31, and has now lost twice in a row at home, a year after going 12-1-4 at BBVA Compass Stadium. "This extra week gives us an opportunity to correct that stuff and harp on it and really figure out what the issues are and solve them," goalkeeper Chris Seitz said, according to the MLS website.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: In this California city, houses probably earn more per hour than you do, report finds
context_meta.summary: Houses in San Francisco earn more per hour than most of their owners – or anyone else, for that matter, – do at work, a new report finds. The study by real estate site Zillow finds that houses in the Bay Area city typically appreciate at a rate of $60.13 for each working hour, calculated based on a 40-hour work week. Minimum wage workers in San Francisco currently take home $14 an hour, rising to $15 an hour this summer. And the average hourly wage in the San Francisco-San Mateo metro area was $36.61 in 2016, reported the U.S. Department of Labor. The national average hourly wage was $23.86. In nearby San Jose, Calif., meanwhile, homes typically appreciate $98.81 per working hour, Zillow reports.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Miller hits for cycle, sparks San Jose's 18-6 win over Lancaster
context_meta.summary: Jalen Miller hit for the cycle, as the San Jose Giants topped the Lancaster JetHawks 18-6 on Wednesday. Miller singled in the first, singled in the second, doubled in the sixth, homered in the eighth, and tripled in the ninth. San Jose had three big innings in the blowout victory, scoring four runs in the first inning, five runs in the second and four runs in the eighth. The key inning was the first, when Gio Brusa hit a two-run home run.

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Old friends: Rival Sharks, Ducks meet in 2nd playoff series
context_meta.summary: Although the San Jose Sharks and the Anaheim Ducks both have been regular Stanley Cup playoff participants for the past 15 years, the California rivals somehow met in the postseason only once before this week. The eighth-seeded Ducks eliminated the top-seeded Sharks in six tempestuous games culminating in the Ducks' clinching home victory, which began with Ryan Getzlaf and Joe Thornton dropping the gloves on the opening faceoff. Getzlaf, Corey Perry and Francois Beauchemin are still around in Anaheim, while Thornton, Marc-Edouard Vlasic and Joe Pavelski are still in teal.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Editorial: Why San Jose City Council should tighten its travel policy
context_meta.summary: San Jose needs to improve its Asian ties, but sending half the City Council to Okayama on taxpayers' dime isn't the best way to go about it. Especially when it means five members missed Tuesday's council meeting when the city is facing a budget shortfall. Instead of discussing that issue or other priorities, such as fighting homelessness, a light agenda was forced on the remaining council. The situation demands a tightening of San Jose's travel policy. Mayor Sam Liccardo, who did not make the trip, is recommending that taxpayers pay for only one council member's expenses for such sister-city trips. Any other council member wanting to attend should use private funding. That makes sense. Sister-city

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: SoCal Family Reported Missing By San Jose Relative
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE, CA — A family traveling from Portland, Oregon, to Santa Clarita in Southern California was scheduled to stop at a relative's home in San Jose on Friday but never showed up, according to San Jose police. Police received a call from the Thottapilly family's relative on Sunday when they requested to file a missing person's report. They were on their way home and never made it to their stop in San Jose. The Thottapilly family has not been seen or heard from since Thursday, according to police. A missing persons report has been filed. context_meta.title: Is a soda tax ballot measure coming to San Jose?
context_meta.summary: The call was short, just a few minutes, and the caller refused to say where she was calling from. But the question was clear: Would you support a soda tax in San Jose?
